reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project idea originated in 2003. It was noticed that Baled-Hawon area is urgently in need of assistance for basic education as well as a new organization of the school building. Diaspora in Finland and other countries have been collecting money and bui lt gradually Waabari school. Action has been initiated with the support of Ministry of Foreign Affairs and has been the opportunity to Waaberi primary school pupils to take more than 420 7-10 year old students and nine staff which is a major development st ep in the region. The number of pupils tripled and number of staff doubled during the first two years of the project. The local people local administration and the federal government are involved and committed to the project and there has been a lot of med ia exposure and positive attention concerning the school project both in Somalia and abroad. In the project's second phase of the teachers are recruited and school buildings are maintained and improved the teaching materials are renewed (such as books desk s). In addition the project will be further introduced to parents regional authorities and residents as well as religious leaders to improve school safety and improve reliability. The project aims to ensure equal access to school for all groups including t hose in vulnrable position (eg girls the poor) and environmental issues are taken into account.
